name: Hotel Grand Chancellor Launceston

reviews.text: Terrible stay in what is supposed to be an upmarket hotel. The day we arrived, Launceston was blisteringly hot, and so was the room. The "air conditioning" was an evaporative cooler, and failed to reduce the room temperature less than 26 degrees. The fan in the bathroom did not work. The broadband did not work. There was no DVD player with the television. Despite leaving feedback, the hotel staff failed to make an attempt at fixing our problems. There was only one staff member with any semblance of customer service skills, the rest were sullen and disinterested.
reviews.title: Everything was broken and no one wanted to fix it...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed 2 nights. paid $135 p/n. rooms are a little tired, but for the price it was fine.
reviews.title: good value for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: easy walking distance to caffees and eateries.
reviews.title: Not that great

reviews.text: service was friendly.
reviews.title: valued for money

reviews.text: From the outside the hotel is beautiful and the room was fine. It seemed to us that management was not strong, because lots of details didn't work. Some of the paint is peeling, the elevators need servicing, and the restaurant service was very slow (half an hour for a cup of coffee although they weren't busy). The location is alright, but the immediate neighbourhood is a bit seedy.
reviews.title: Would have been Grand once upon a time..

reviews.text: I was disappointed on my visit here 2 years ago but have recently stayed here again and have to compliment the Hotel - the room and facilities were very clean and staff were welcoming and friendly. I was upgraded to a king sized bed, the staff at reception were very helpful and I enjoyed my stay here very much.
reviews.title: Vast improvement to previous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night recently in a superior king room with breakfast for $179, plus $6 for parking. The rate was much reduced on the usual price. The accommodation was very adequate, but not outstanding. The location was central, and the staff were helpful but looked overworked and busy. We stayed on the 5th floor. The room and the bathroom were spacious, and the bed was comfortable. The decor was dated and is in need of an update. The breakfast was great; wide choice and well cooked. My biggest issue was with the heating in the room. There was no heating control. I presume there was heating coming in through the vent high up on the wall, but I found it cold (it was a minus 2 degree C. night). The water pressure was good, and the rooms seemed well sound-proofed. There was no noise at all in the rooms. The television channel selection is ordinary. It didn't have a full-range of free-to-air channels, while two of the limited range were dedicated to sports. A free paper appeared at the door in the morning, which was appreciated.
reviews.title: Very adequate but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While in the foyer waiting to check out, three local boys with their skate boards tucked under their arms pilfered coins from the fairly tacky fountain in the centre of the foyer; they pretended to be admiring the pebbles beneath the water. No-one took any notice for some time until I called the attention of someone at the desk to them, and the staff member chased them out.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and exceptional service

reviews.text: Overall, good location and comfortable but pedestrian. Certainly not a good choice for a special stay, like a honeymoon.
reviews.title: Acceptable if you get a good rate. Rather Dated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a lovely surprise given some of the reviews on here (was the only place available on the night) our room was beautiful with a great view, the service at reception, at the restaurant and at the bar was all fantastic. Couldn't fault the cleanliness, amenities or the bed which was very very comfy. I couldn't quite figure out the heating system but a pretty minor thing to even mention. It would now be a first choice for me in Launceston.
reviews.title: Good value, convenient and comfortable
Oudated and Disappointed
reviews.text: Pros
- Close to the city center with some restaurants and shops nearby
reviews.title: will return

reviews.text: - Clean rooms
reviews.title: A bit dated and expensive

reviews.text: Cons
reviews.title: Room Standard Leaves a lot to be desired

reviews.text: - Room decor quite dated and in need of renovation
reviews.title: Clean and good location

reviews.text: The Hotel is good and very comfortable. Very central location. Rooms good but feels outdated with furnishings and decor in general. Dining area/buffet feels outdated also. Staff are all very friendly
reviews.title: Dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Chancellor for 3 nights and couldn't fault it.
reviews.title: Great central location.Clean and comfortable stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some negative reviews I was a bit dubious but arrived to find yes a dated but very clean and fantastically located hotel.
reviews.title: So glad we stayed at Hotel Grand Chancellor

reviews.text: The staff went out of their way to help us with reservations and recommendations to restaurants etc.
reviews.title: Not so Grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spacious with a comfortable king size bed and lounge area with two corner windows.
reviews.title: Old and out of date

description: Hotel Grand Chancellor Launceston, the city's premier 4 1/2 star hotel, offers superior accommodation, superb Tasmanian cuisine and extensive conference facilities in the centre of the northern capital of Tasmania. Catering for the discerning corporate and leisure traveller, Hotel Grand Chancellor Launceston is only a short stroll from the main central business district, shopping malls and Aurora Sports Stadium. Features include: 165 Hotel Rooms, Executive Club Lounge, 8 Convention Rooms & Restaurant & Bar.
